Name: Current effort
Description: A reference input control that maintains current effort (subject to fishing efficiency changes)

Name: 75% of Current effort
Description: A reference input control that maintains 75% of current effort

Name: Delay-Difference- effort control
Description: Effort control version of DD - Delay - Difference Stock Assessment with UMSY and MSY leading

Name: Delay-Difference- effort control 75%
Description: Effort control version of DD - Delay - Difference Stock Assessment with UMSY and MSY leading that fishes at 75 per cent of FMSY

Name: Delay-Difference- effort control 75% effort searching
Description: Effort searching version of DD - Delay - Difference Stock Assessment with UMSY and MSY leading that fishes at 75 per cent of FMSY

Name: Effort adjusted target CPUE
Description: Management procedure incrementally adjusts the effort to reach a target CPUE / relative abundance index.

Name: Effort adjusted target CPUE
Description: Management procedure incrementally adjusts the effort to reach a target CPUE / relative abundance index.

Name: Effort adjusted to recent mean length version 1
Description: Management procedure that incrementally adjusts the effort according to the mean length of recent catches.

Name: Effort adjusted to recent mean length version 2
Description: Management procedure that incrementally adjusts the effort according to the mean length of recent catches.

Name: Effort adjusted to rmean length version 1
Description: A management procedure that incrementally adjusts the TAC to reach a target mean length in catches.

Name: Effort adjusted to mean length version 2
Description: A management procedure that incrementally adjusts the TAC to reach a target mean length in catches.

Name: Length selectivity equal to maturity
Description: Fishing selectivity is set according to the maturity curve

Name: Length selectivity higher than maturity
Description: fishing selectivity is set slightly higher than the maturity curve

Name: Age selectivity matches the maturity curve
Description: Fishing selectivity at age is the same as fraction mature at age

Name: Area 1 Marine Reserve with reallocation
Description: Sets a marine reserve in Area 1 and reallocates fishing effort to area 2

Name: Area 1 Marine Reserve with no reallocation
Description: Sets a marine reserve in Area 1 with no reallocation of fishing effort to area 2

Name: Slot limit
Description: Sets a slot limit to control effort.

Name: Average Catch
Description: Sets TAC as average historical catch

Name: Beddington and Kirkwood life-history
Description: Sets an OFL according to current abundance and an approximation of FMSY based on length at first capture.

Name: BK linked to a catch curve
Description: Catch-curve analysis is used to estimate current abundance that is linked to BK FMSY estimate to give the OFL

Name: BK linked to a mean length
Description: Mean length estimate of current F (abundance) is linked to BK FMSY estimate to provide the OFL

Name: Constant catch linked to average catches
Description: TAC is a average historical catches

Name: Constant catch linked to average catches
Description: TAC is 70% of average historical catches

Name: Age Composition - Stock Reduction Analysis
Description: What constant F creates the current composition, what is FMSY? OFL = FMSY x F / C

Name: CompSRA linked to a 40-10 rule
Description: A 40-10 harvest control rule is added to the CompSRA MP

Name: Depletion Adjusted Average Catch
Description: DCAC multiplied by 2*depletion and divided by BMSY/B0 (Bpeak)

Name: Hybrid Depletion Adjusted Average Catch
Description: DCAC multiplied by 2*depletion and divided by BMSY/B0 (Bpeak) when below BMSY, and DCAC above BMSY.

Name: Depletion-Based Stock Reduction Analysis
Description: The OFL is M x (FMSY/M) x depletion x unfished biomass (the first three factors are user defined, the fourth is determined by historical catches and stock reduction analysis)

Name: DBSRA assuming current depletion is 40%
Description: DBSRA where stock depletion is fixed at 40%

Name: DBSRA using mean length to estimate depletion
Description: Mean length estimate of depletion is used to inform DBSRA depletion

Name: DBSRA linked to a 40-10 rule
Description: A 40-10 harvest control rule is added to the DBSRA MP

Name: Depletion-Corrected Average Catch
Description: An MSY proxy that accounts for catches occuring whilst dropping to productive stock sizes

Name: DCAC using mean length to estimate depletion
Description: Mean length estimate of depletion is used to inform DCAC depletion

Name: DCAC assuming depletion is 40%
Description: DCAC where stock depletion is fixed at 40%

Name: DCAC linked to a 40-10 rule
Description: A 40-10 harvest control rule is added to the DCAC MP

Name: Extra DCAC
Description: DCAC * 2 * depletion * B0 / BMSY

Name: Delay-Difference assessment
Description: A delay difference model is fitted to historical abundance indices and catches. The model does not estimate process error.

Name: DD linked to a 40-10 rule
Description: A 40-10 harvest control rule is added to the DD MP

Name: Fratio linked to a production curve control rule
Description: Below BMSY, the OFL is mulitplied by a production curve ie. dep x (1-dep) x 4

Name: Dynamic Fratio MP
Description: Inferred derivative of surplus production with biomass is used to adjust F in relation to M

Name: Adaptive F MP
Description: Inferred derivative of surplus production with biomass is used to adjust F between bounds FMSY/2 and 2FMSY

Name: Demographic FMSY method
Description: FMSY is calculated as r/2 where r is calculated from a demographic approach (inc steepness). Coupled with an estimate of current abundance that gives you the OFL.

Name: Fdem linked to a catch curve
Description: Current abundance estimates from a catch curve are linked to Fdem estimate of FMSY

Name: Fdem using mean length to estimate depletion
Description: Mean length estimate of current abundance is lined to Fdem estimate of FMSY

Name: FMSY ref
Description: A reference FMSY method (uses perfect information about FMSY)

Name: Half of FMSY ref
Description: 50% of true simulated OFL

Name: 75% of FMSY ref
Description: 75% of true simulated OFL

Name: Fixed FMSY to M ratio
Description: FMSY is a fixed fraction of natural mortality rate

Name: Fratio with 40-10 rule
Description: Calculates the OFL based on a fixed FMSY/M multiplied by a current estimate of abundance. In this method DBSRA is paired with the 40-10 rule; OFL = 0 at B10%.

Name: Fratio linked to a catch curve
Description: Current abundance estimates from a catch curve are linked to the Fratio MP

Name: Fratio using mean length to estimate depletion
Description: Mean length estimate of depletion is used to inform Fratio abundance

Name: Fratio linked to a 40-10 rule
Description: A 40-10 harvest control rule is added to the Fratio MP

Name: Geromont and Butterworth constant catch
Description: MSY seeking rule that uses average historical catch as a proxy for MSY

Name: Geromont and Butterworth CPUE slope
Description: TAC recommendations to stabilize CPUE

Name: Geromont and Butterworth target CPUE and catch
Description: TAC recommendations to achieve target CPUE and target catch

Name: G-control MP
Description: Inferred derivative of surplus production with biomass is used to alter the TAC

Name: CPUE slope MP
Description: TAC is adjusted to maintain constant CPUE

Name: CPUE slope MP (more biologically precautionary)
Description: TAC is adjusted to maintain constant CPUE

Name: CPUE target MP
Description: TAC is adjusted to achieve a target CPUE

Name: CPUE target MP (more biologically precautionary)
Description: TAC is adjusted to achieve a target CPUE

Name: Mean length MP
Description: Mean length relative to historical levels is used to alter the TAC

Name: Mean length MP (more biologically precautionary)
Description: Mean length relative to historical levels is used to alter the TAC

Name: Length target MP
Description: TAC is adjusted to reach a target mean length

Name: Length target MP (more biologically precautionary)
Description: TAC is adjusted to reach a target mean length

Name: Mean Catch Depletion MP
Description: MP to demonstrate high information content of depletion OFL = mean catches x 2 x dep

Name: MCD linked to a 40-10 rule
Description: A 40-10 harvest control rule is added to the MCD MP

Name: No reference point
Description: Sets catch = 0.

Name: R-control MP
Description: A demographic prior for intrinsic rate of increase is used to firm up surplus production calculation of G-control

Name: Rcontrol with quadratic SP-B relationship
Description: As Rcontrol but fits a quadratic relationship to the derivative of SP with stock biomass

Name: Southern Bluefin Tuna 1
Description: An MP that adjusts TACs according to apparent trend in CPUE

Name: Southern Bluefin Tuna 2
Description: An MP that adjusts TACs according to achieve target CPUE and catch

Name: Surplus production based TAC modifier
Description: Inferred derivative of surplus production with biomass is used to adjust the TAC

Name: Catch-trend MSY MP
Description: Catch trends reflect depletion and combined with catches can be used to find viable r-K pairs. The OFL is dep x (1-dep) x 2 x r x K

Name: Slope in surplus production MP
Description: Inferred derivative of surplus production with biomass is used to adjust the TAC

Name: Surplus Production Stock Reduction Analysis
Description: Like DBSRA but uses a surplus prodcution model and a prior for intrinisic rate of increase

Name: SPSRA using mean length to estimate depletion
Description: mean length estimate of depletion is used to inform SPSRA depletion

Name: Yield Per Recruit
Description: Yield Per Recruit estimate of F0.1 (FMSY proxy) multiplied by estimate of current stock biomass

Name: YPR linked to a catch-curve
Description: Current abundance estimates of a catch curve analysis is linked to the YPR MP

Name: YPR using mean lenth to estimate current abundance
Description: Mean length estimate of current abundance is used to inform YPR abundance
